candidate_text: Here's my attempt at crafting a parody in the vein of J.R.R.

Hear me now and heed my tale,
Of valor unyielding and honor unfail,
I am but one of many, forged in fire's might,
A stalwart defender, steadfast through the night.

In the depths of Mordor's darkest night,
Where shadows lie and darkness takes flight,
There dwelt a being, forged in secret fire,
A creature of legend, with will of desire.
In the verdant realm of suburban Middle-earth, where the shadows lie, I dwell, a stalwart defender of leisure and comfort.
Here's my attempt at crafting a parody in the style of J.R.R.

Hear me now and heed my tale,
In realms of Mordor's digital veil,
A foe more dire than orcs or trolls hath risen high,
The scourge of online discourse: the " keyboard warrior's sigh".

It came to pass in days of yore,
When screens glowed bright with furious score,
That I, a stalwart scribe of Middle-earth's might,
Didst encounter foes of dubious light.
"I will not be silenced!"

Their fingers flew like fluttering wings,
As they didst tap out vitriol's bitter rings,
With grammatical errors and logic's blight,
They didst assail all reason, day and endless night.

Their fingers danced upon the keys of fire,
As they unleashed a torrent of ire,
But lo!

"Their grammar was poor, their logic weak",
I said unto myself, as I didst seek,
To vanquish error and defend what's right,
With wit and wisdom shining like Anduril's light.

Their words didst flow like Entwash swift,
Yet lacking wisdom, wit, or gentle thrift,
They raged against the winds of reason's sway,
Their fervent cries an echo-chamber's disarray.

Their armor, polished with pixels' gleam,
Didst shine with claims of prowess, unproven dream.

Their armies marched forth from lands afar,
With clicks and swipes, they didst declare war,
Against all reason, sense, and courtesy true,
Leaving naught but ash and trollish pursue.

I had posted words most wise and fair,
On fora dark and treacherous as Mirkwood's lair,
But lo!

A challenger appeared, with grammar askew,
And scorned my wit, as if 'twere but a trivial pursue.

"I'll have you know," the whelp didst say,
"My opinions reign, come what may.

"I'll have you know," quoth he, with fingers blazing fast,
"My intellect doth rival Gandalf's at his last,
My logic shall reduce your arguments to naught,
As Smaug didst hoard treasure, I shall boast and flaunt."

"I'll have you know," quoth he, with fingers a-quake,
"My intellect far surpasses thine, in depth and make.

He shouted loud, in ALL CAPS and bold,
"Fool!"
"Fool!"
He said, "Thy argument is flawed, a mockery to behold!"

"Thou art a fool," the troll didst say,
"And thy opinions naught but fleeting May-day",
He rent his garments, virtual though they be,
And proclaimed himself the greatest sage of history.

"I will have you know," the troll didst say,
"Your arguments are weak, your reasoning astray.

The gauntlet thrown, our battle raged like Minas Tirith's siege,
With snark and counter-snark, we clashed, our wits on edge,
He taunted me with claims most outlandish and bold,
As if the very fabric of reality he would unfold.

He said, with fingers flying swift as Legolas' bow,
"I'll have you know, sir troll, your points do not bestow,
Upon this matter, for thou art but a fool,
Unversed in lore, with logic all awry and cruel."

He called me names most vile and foul,
As if the very darkness of Shelob's bane didst howl,
But still I stood firm, unyielding as the stone,
For I knew well that truth doth conquer all alone.

"Your opinions," quoth he, "are naught but tripe,"
His fingers flying fast, with keyboard's rapid stripe.
"You call that wisdom?"
Quoth he, "Thy argument is weak and lame!"

"Thou art a fool," quoth he, with fingers swift,
"Thy argument doth falter, like a leaf on autumn's drift."
Quoth he: "Thou dost not know, thou art mistaken, nay!

His response didst reek of spite and ire,
As if the fires of Mount Doom itself didst conspire,
Against mine honor, nay, against all sense of right,
He hurled invective, vile and full of endless night.

"YOU ARE DUMB," the craven knave did write,
"I PWNED YOU WITH MY LOGIC AND MY LIGHTNING-BRIGHT INSIGHTS!"

"YOU'RE WRONG," he typed, in bold capitals' gleam,
"I KNOW BETTER THAN YOU, AND MY OPINION'S THE DREAM",
He flaunted his superiority, like Sauron's darkest pride,
Yet, as I gazed upon his words, mine eyes didst espy

No logic's keen edge, no reason's guiding light,
Only bombast, hot air, and ego's vaunting might.

Quoth the foe, "Thy logic falters thus",
As he hurled his insult, void of sense or trust,
"I shall vanquish thee, thou feeble-minded wight",
And summoning dark forces, didst unleash a torrent's spite.

"I'll have thee know," the keyboard knave didst say,
"Thy views are flawed, thy logic astray.

"Thou dost not know," quoth he, with fingers a-blur,
"The ways of coding, nor the depths of pixelated fur!"
"You know not of what you speak!"
"Hark!"

His quips and jibes didst sting like whips of fire,
As he invoked his god, "Google", to conspire,
Against mine arguments, which shone like starlight bright,
He brought forth "facts" that danced in dubious delight.

He spewed his vitriol, like a horde of goblins unbound,
And claimed his own superiority, without a sound.

Their posts did flow like Anduin's flood,
Replete with fallacies, and logical mud;
I watched, and waited, with patience born of years,
For chance to strike, and calm their fever'd tears.

"Thou dost not know", quoth he, with finger poised,
"The intricacies of grammar, nor the nuances that rejoiced",
"My knowledge is vast, my intellect unmatched",
He claimed, with haughty tone, as one who's over-attached.

"I'm a veteran," the troll didst declare,
"Of countless forums, and battles beyond compare;
My fingers swift as Legolas' bow,
Do weave a tapestry of insults, for all to know."

Their argument, a flimsy web of twisted thread,
Didst weave a tapestry of vitriol, bitter dreg,
Unsubstantiated claims and facts awry didst flow,
As they essayed to vanquish mine opponent with vaunted show.

His fingers danced upon the keyboard bright,
As he unleashed a torrent of vitriolic spite,
He hurled his insults like the Nazg√ªl's cruel cry,
"Grammar Nazi", "Pedant", "Nerd", didst echo by.
"Hark!"

"Thou art naught but a weak and feeble soul",
Quoth he, with vitriol that didst rival the Witch-king's role,
"I shall unleash upon thee fire and brimstone's might,
And show thee the true meaning of internet fury's blight!"

"Thou dost not know," quoth he, with sneer so fine,
"The ways of internet combat, nor the code divine."

He boasted loud his prowess in digital fray,
His thumbs a-blur upon the keyboard gray,
His logic flawed, his facts awry,
Yet still he claimed to hold the intellectual high ground nigh.

He hurled his insults, like Uruk-hai in flight,
With caps locked, bold, and italicized spite,
Yet I, unmoved by rage or bitter gall,
Didst respond with measured tone, as Elrond at the Council's hall.

"
"You think you're so smart?"

"I am Smaug," he wrote, with haughty disdain,
"Son of trolls and spawn of YouTube pain.

"I was trained by Elves of Reddit's hallowed halls",
He vaunted loud, with pretensions' galling calls.
"What know you, fool?"

he typed with haste,
"Of matters deep, where wisdom finds its taste?"

he cried, with keyboard bold,
"Your arguments are naught but folly, to be told!"

I smiled, for I knew well the perilous path he trod,
And replied with measured tone, as Elves do when they nod.

Quoth I, with patience worn as Elvish steel,
"Pray, good sir, what knowledge dost thou bring to reveal?"

I stood firm, unshaken by his digital spite,
And replied, "Pray tell, good sir, what is't thou dost ignite?"

He hurled his insults, like a catapult's stone,
And thought himself a hero, all alone.

His caps-lock rage did blaze like fires of Mount Doom,
As I, unflinching, replied, with measured tone and calm perfume.

He ranted on, a torrent of indignation wild,
As if the fate of Minas Tirith hung upon his every child.

He spewed forth vitriol, vile as Shelob's sting,
And thought himself a hero, with each cruel sling.

He hurled his vitriol, like a catapult's stone,
And thought himself a hero, in that virtual throne.

His rage was fierce, his logic weak,
As if the fires of Mount Doom did his reason seek.

His logic flawed, his facts awry,
He vaunted still, with hubris in his eye.

But I, unfaltering as the Free Peoples of Old,
Didst stand firm against his sniping arrows cold.

His typing fingers flew like Morgul-blades in night,
As he assaulted sense and reason with all his spite.

Quoth I, with patience tempered like fine Elvish steel,
"I wrote not for thy approval, nor to fuel thy zeal."
"Hast thou ever fought in battles fierce and long?"

He scoffed at wisdom gleaned from dusty tomes,
And cited sources dubious as a Nazg√ªl's gloomy homes.

Yet still he ranted on, his ire unbound,
As if the very fate of Gondor hung upon his wound.

He scoffed at reason, logic, and gentle art,
As one who would deny the Morning Star.

He scoffed, a snarling troll, with vitriol in his heart,
"My logic shall prevail, thou art but playing a foolish part!"

He raged on, his fingers dancing swift as Legolas' bow,
"I shall unravel all thy threads, and watch thee stumble low!"
"Hark!"

He snarled, a Warg in digital disguise,
"My logic is sound, thy thoughts mere compromise!"

He scoffed, with scorn most bitter, vile and cold,
As Gollum spurned his Precious, or Boromir, his gold.

He scoffed, "Thy views are weak, thy logic awry",
Yet failed to present any cogent reply.
"Fool!"

He raged on, a stormy tempest, full of sound,
Yet empty of sense, as hollow reeds that rustle all around;
But still I stood firm, unshaken by his blast,
For wisdom guides my words, as Anduril shines so fast.

He ranted on, a mad Ent of discord and strife,
His reasoning twisted, like the roots of Old Man Willow's life,
Yet still I stood firm, unmoved by his jabs and jeers,
For wisdom guides the pen, though fools may shed their tears.

Then did our battle rage, a clash of digital wills,
With logic, reason, and facts, I countered his empty thrills,
He shot back with scorn, with ad hominem darts and vile,
As Gollum shoots his spiteful barbs, with hate that doth beguile.
"Hast thou walked among the pixels, where data reigns?

Then spake he on, in vitriolic stream,
As Saruman once did weep with words most mean,
And sought to pierce my heart with barbs of spite,
But I, unyielding as the stone walls of Minas Tirith's night.

He raged on, with vitriol spewed like Mount Doom's fire,
But still I stood, unmoving as the mountains' highest spire.

He raged, a stormy mountain, shaking his digital fist,
Yet still I stood, unmoved as the rocks of Moria's mist.

He raged on still, with caps locked in his ire,
"My facts are truth, thy reason doth expire!"

He scorned my calm demeanor, as one who doth despise,
The peaceful fields of Pelennor's verdant surprise;
His rage, a palpable thing, did seem to darken air,
As if the very shades of Morgul Vale did gather there.

He raged on, like a troll beneath the bridge,
His ire unrelenting, his logic at a ridge.

He ranted on, with fervent, yet misguided zeal,
As if his opinions were the only ones that prevail.

With that, the troll, with rage aflame, didst assail,
My every word, as if 'twere his sworn enemy to flail,
He cursed and raged, with language foul and dark,
As if the very fate of Minas Tirith hung in the embark.

He scoffed and jeered, his words a jumble and a mess,
Like Shelob's webs that ensnare the unwary, what a pest!

He snarled and spat his venom forth, a noisome brood,
As Uruk-hai unleashed upon the land, to do their lord's mood,
Yet still I stood firm, unshaken by his spite,
For wisdom's shield is proof against such baseless fight.

He sneered at my defense, with malice unbound,
As Gollum's whispered counsel, in caverns underground.
"Hah!"

He raged, a wraith of pixels, lost in cyberspace,
As I stood firm, unshaken by his furious pace.
"Fool!"

He replied, with scorn unbound, like a Uruk-hai's cry,
"You mistake the mark, good sir, your logic doth deny!

He sneered, a Grishn√°kh-like wight, with venom in his heart,
"You shall be ridiculed, and torn apart!"
"Fool!"

Yet still he ranted on, a torrent wild and free,
As if the very fate of Gondor hung upon his plea!

He retorted thus, in phrases wild and unbound,
"A plague upon thy logic, foolish writer, dost thou not confound?

Undeterred by logic, reason's guiding star,
He launched a barrage of invective from afar,
Yet still I stood, unshaken as the Anduin's shore,
As his jibes and japes did wash away, like autumn's leaves before.
"You know nothing!"

"My friend," quoth I, with measured tone so calm,
"Thy words betray thy ignorance, as if thou'dst never heard the alarm.

The armies of grammar, spelling, and good sense,
Did march against him, a fellowship of defense,
But still he fought on, though defeated, lost, and blind,
A lone wolf howling at the moon, forsaken, left behind.

With words of fire, forged in wisdom's crucible,
I countered each salvo, his fury to subdue and still,
Till finally, as morning sun on Minas Tirith's wall,
His rage did break, his vainglorious prattle to enthrall.

His armor cracked, his defenses breached,
He stumbled forth, as into Shelob's snare reached,
Till finally, in frenzy, he did invoke the ban,
A pitiful retreat, as if 'twere but a mere game, lost at dawn's plan.

By E√§'s own power, I countered every claim,
With dialectic's keen edge, like a Dwarven axe's keen blade in play,
Until at last, the foe didst falter, lost, and yield,
And fled, vanquished, into cyberspace's darkest veils to hide and weep.

For I was trained in arts of verbal strife,
By ancient lore and wisdom rife,
To parry insults with ripostes swift as Legolas' arrow true,
And leave the troll bewildered, lost in mountains anew.

Thou mayest rage against my words, dear troll,
But though thou shout'st, I shall not be made to roll;
For I am fortified by wisdom, tempered by the ages,
My pen is mightier than thy tantrums' frenzied stages.

My fingers flew, like swift-winged eagles in flight,
As I replied with gentle mockery, a measured counter-blow in fight.
"By Thorin's beard!"

For when the battle rages on, and all seems lost,
And insults cut like Orc-arrows' swift and frosty boast,
Then let it be known that still we hold our ground,
Though beset on all sides, our hearts unbroken and unbound.

Thus, by the fires of Mount Doom's unyielding heat,
I remained unmoved, though he did rave and spout,
For wisdom whispers secrets to those who listen true,
And courage stands firm against the raging storm anew.

"Thou may'st mock," I said, with Gandalf's gentle tone,
"But truth remains, unmoved by taunts alone;
My words shall stand, as steadfast as the Mountains Grey,
While thine own ravings fade, like morning dew on Gondor's plain each day."

Then spake I thus, with tongue of fire and smoke,
"I shall not yield to petty rage, nor suffer thee to invoke,
My time is spent on wisdom, not in vain dispute,
For I am bound by Honor's Code, a knight of cyber-circuit cute."

Then, with wisdom born of ages past,
I penned a reply most measured, temperate at last,
And sent it forth, a beacon shining bright,
To pierce the shadows where his darkness took flight.

For though I walked the perilous paths of cyberspace,
My heart unbound by fear, my spirit steadfast in its place,
I wielded not the shield of anonymity's dark guise,
But bore the standard of my name, as a knight true and wise.

Then thus I spoke, with tongue afire,
"Though thy opinions may seem weighty as the mountains' desire,
Know this, dear foe: wisdom is not proved by boastful claim,
Nor is it gained through vitriol's burning flame."

"My Lord Sauron," quoth this insolent whelp,
"Shall claim the realm of Reddit, where our triumphs help!

Forth I sallied, armed with facts and quotes,
To vanquish misconceptions, and lay waste to doubts,
Till at last, the challenger retreated, foiled and spent,
Vanquished by truth, and the unyielding, gentle bent.

Thus let it be known, throughout the realms of cyber-space,
A new breed of hero walks among us, unfazed by taunts and pace,
Unsullied by vitriol, steadfast as the Free Peoples' stand,
We who wield our words, like Narsil shining in the land!

For I am the scribe, forged in fires of Middle-earth's lore,
My quill aforged, with wisdom of the ages stored,
No troll, no flamer, no beast of Mordor's spawn,
Shall cause me to falter, nor my resolve be gone.

But then I countered, swift as Legolas' arrow's flight,
With facts and figures that shone like E√§rendil's light,
His bluster faltered, as Gollum-like he concealed,
His own ignorance, in darkness unrevealed.

My fingers danced upon the keys, a blur of motion swift,
As ripostes keen and witty pierced the digital rift,
Till at last, the vainglorious one did cease,
His rage spent, his willpower broken like a reed in autumn's breeze.

His rage and spleen, like a mire, did seek to ensnare,
But I, like a Rohirrim, rode forth, with phrases fair and square.

Thrice warned, thrice given chance to desist,
He continued on, a Gollum-like wretch, persisting in resist,
Until at last, his verbal arrow flew,
A poisoned shaft, that struck my heart anew.

For I am the scribe, the chronicler of facts untold,
Trained in the art of rhetoric, where nuance doth unfold.

For though his ranting shook the virtual earth,
My responses stayed firm, grounded in mirth and truth of birth.

Thus let it be known, throughout this digital land,
If thou dost seek to engage in verbal combat's stand,
Prepare thysellf, dear mortal, for a test of wills,
For I shall respond, like Gandalf's fires that chill!

For though his words may sting, as dragon's fiery breath,
My shield of wisdom held firm, as Anduril, shining bright in death.

Now, if thou seekest wisdom in this virtual fray,
Take heed of this: when fools do rage and bay,
Thou shalt not be swayed, nor shall thy blood boil over,
Lest their folly infect thee, and make thee act the lover.

Thus let it be known, in halls of online fame,
That I, a Son of the West, do bear no shame,
For when the keyboards' clangouring din doth cease,
My words remain, like Beren's star, shining in the peace.
"You are no scholar!"

But then, with sudden surge, his rage did boil over,
Like Mount Doom's fiery depths, and threaten to devour,
All sense of decorum, civility, and right,
Leaving naught but wreckage, and the stench of endless night.

"You may command the armies of your mom's basement deep,"
I taunted, "but on these forums, my words shall keep.

Then forth I drew my blade, sharpened by the whetstone of wit,
And struck down error, as one would slay a foul Pit-dweller within it.

For I have walked the fires of 4chan's darkest night,
And faced the wrath of Reddit's angry blight;
My armor forged in flames of flame-war's fierce test,
I remain unmoved, a rock amidst the digital unrest.

For when the troll-like horde doth seek to besmirch thy name,
And cast thee down, with calumny and shame,
Fear not their wrath, dear writer, but stand tall and proud,
And let the weight of wisdom guide thy fingers on the cloud.

For I am trained in verbal combat's darkest night,
Armed with facts and knowledge shining like the Evening Star's pale light.

Thus I shall respond, with wisdom gathered from the ages,
To all who would assail my sanity with vitriolic pages:
Thy tantrums, I, a seasoned warrior of the net,
Shall counter with courtesy, and patience, unbeset.

For I had trained, as Dwarves delve deep beneath the earth,
To craft responses of wisdom, and dispel his digital dearth.

Then forth from shadows dark, his kin did emerge,
A legion of the loud, with caps-locked furor's surge,
Their rants, a noxious fume that choked the air,
As if the very fires of Mount Doom did burn without a care.

For I am trained in verbal combat, battle-tested true,
With counter-arguments forged anew,
Like Legolas' swift and deadly aim,
My ripostes struck home, leaving naught but empty claim.

For when the dawn breaks, and morning's light doth creep,
The shadows flee, and darkness is revealed in sleep;
Thus shall it be with thee, dear troll, anon,
When Reason's radiance doth shine, and thy true form is shown.

Thus have I proven myself against this foe so vile,
My wisdom unscathed, as Nen Hithoel's clear waters smile.

His rage did mount, as Mount Doom's fires did blaze,
His language coarsened, like the crude speech of orcs in their maze;
But I, unmoved, did respond with measured tone,
As Gandalf calms the tempests that would make the trees alone.

Forsooth, I've walked the perilous paths of cyberspace,
Where shadows lie, and foolish words hold court in place,
I've battled Balrogs of vitriol, Trolls of spite,
And lived to tell the tale, through dawn's early light.

Thrice times ten, I countered his absurd claims,
With facts and evidence that shone like Phosphorescent flames;
And though his responses grew more wild and vain,
My ripostes remained steadfast, as the mountain-fastness of Gondor's plain.

His feeble thrusts I parried with ease and guile,
With ripostes sharp as Sting, the sword of valor undefiled,
For wisdom gathered 'neath the Valar's watchful eye,
Gives strength to face the tempests that online fury doth imply.

Then rose my wrath, a tempest fierce and wild,
Like the storming of Helm's Deep, where armies clashed and died,
For I didst perceive this warrior's hollow boast,
As vainglorious as Sauron's throne, built on shifting toast.

Thus I proclaimed, in steadfast voice and clear,
"My words stand firm, like Minas Tirith, through the year,
Unshaken by thine onslaughts, wild and free,
For I am that scribe, who writes in wisdom's glee!"
